009
010package imagingbook.common.filter.nonlinear;
011
012import imagingbook.common.filter.generic.GenericFilterVector;
013import imagingbook.common.filter.mask.CircularMask;
014import imagingbook.common.image.PixelPack;
015import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
016import imagingbook.common.math.VectorNorm;
017
018import java.util.Arrays;
019
020/**
021 * <p>
022 * Sharpening vector median filter for color images implemented by extending the {@link GenericFilterVector} class. See
023 * Sec. 15.2.3 of [1] for details.
024 * </p>
025 * <p>
026 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer
027 * (2022).
028 * </p>
029 *
030 * @author WB
031 * @version 2022/12/10
032 */
033public class VectorMedianFilterSharpen extends GenericFilterVector {
034        
035        public static class Parameters extends VectorMedianFilter.Parameters {
036                /** Sharpening factor (0 = none, 1 = max.) */
037                public double sharpen = 0.5;
038                /** Threshold for replacing the current center pixel */
039                public double threshold = 0.0;  
040        }
041        
042        private final Parameters params;
043        private final CircularMask mask;
044        private final int maskCount;
045        private final byte[][] maskArray;
046        private final int xc, yc;
047        private final float[][] supportRegion;          // supportRegion[i][c] with index i, color component c
048        private final VectorNorm vNorm;
049        private final int a;                                            // a = 2,...,n
050        private final float[] vals = new float[3];      // check, adapt to depth
051        
052        public VectorMedianFilterSharpen() {    
053                this(new Parameters());
054        }
055        
056        public VectorMedianFilterSharpen(Parameters params) {
057                this.params = params;
058                this.mask = new CircularMask(params.radius);
059                this.maskCount = mask.getElementCount();
060                this.maskArray = mask.getByteArray();
061                this.xc = mask.getCenterX();
062                this.yc = mask.getCenterY();
063                this.supportRegion = new float[maskCount][3];
064                this.a = (int) Math.round(maskCount - params.sharpen * (maskCount - 2));
065                this.vNorm = params.distanceNorm.getInstance();
066        }
067        
068        @Override
069        protected float[] doPixel(PixelPack pack, int u, int v) {
070                float[] pCtr = pack.getPix(u, v);
071                getSupportRegion(pack, u, v);
072                double dCtr = trimmedAggregateDistance(pCtr, a); 
073                double dMin = Double.MAX_VALUE;
074                int jMin = -1;
075                for (int j = 0; j < supportRegion.length; j++) {
076                        //float[] p = supportRegion[j];
077                        double d = trimmedAggregateDistance(supportRegion[j], a);
078                        if (d < dMin) {
079                                jMin = j;
080                                dMin = d;
081                        }
082                }
083                float[] pmin = supportRegion[jMin];
084                // modify this pixel only if the min aggregate distance of some
085                // other pixel in the filter region is smaller
086                // than the aggregate distance of the original center pixel:
087                float[] pF = new float[3];                      // the returned color tupel
088                if (dCtr - dMin > params.threshold * a) {       // modify this pixel
089                        Matrix.copyD(pmin, pF);
090                }
091                else {  // keep the original pixel value
092                        Matrix.copyD(pCtr, pF);
093                }
094                return pF;
095        }
096        
097        private void getSupportRegion(PixelPack src, int u, int v) {
098                // fill 'supportRegion' for current mask position
099                int k = 0;
100                for (int i = 0; i < maskArray.length; i++) {
101                        int ui = u + i - xc;
102                        for (int j = 0; j < maskArray[0].length; j++) {
103                                if (maskArray[i][j] != 0) {
104                                        int vj = v + j - yc;
105                                        src.getPix(ui, vj, vals);
106                                        Matrix.copyD(vals, supportRegion[k]);
107                                        k = k + 1;
108                                }
109                        }
110                }
111        }
112        
113        private double trimmedAggregateDistance(float[] p, int a) {
114                if (a <= 1) {
115                        return 0;       // aggregate distance of rank 1 is always zero
116                }
117                final int N = supportRegion.length;
118                final double[] R = new double[N];
119                for (int i = 0; i < N; i++) {
120                        R[i] = vNorm.distance(p, supportRegion[i]);
121                }
122                if (a < N) {
123                        Arrays.sort(R); // only sort if the rank is less than N
124                }
125                double d = 0;
126                for (int i = 1; i < a; i++) {
127                        d = d + R[i];
128                }
129                return d;
130        }
131
132}
